org.openstreetmap.travelingsalesman.navigation
Class NavigationManager

java.lang.Object
  org.openstreetmap.travelingsalesman.navigation.NavigationManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGPSProvider.IGPSListener
public class NavigationManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGPSProvider.IGPSListener

The NavigationManager is a helper-class to simplify the core of a navigation-system. (As opposed to a simple route-planing.) It accepts a list of targets and will take care or updating the route as the driver moves along. Thus a simple navigation-program need not care about implementing all the house-keeping like snapping the gps- location to the route and re-calculating the route if the driver did a "wrong" turn.

Author:
Marcus Wolschon

getSelector

public Selector getSelector()
Optional selector to determine what ways we are allowed to travel on. (The map may also contain power-lines, train-lanes, political boundaries, ... that we are not to route on.) May be null. Defaults to null.

Returns:
the selector

setSelector

public void setSelector(Selector aSelector)

aSelector - the selector to set

getDestinations

public java.util.List<Place> getDestinations()
Never null. Read only! Contains only the unreached destinations!

Returns:
the destinations

setDestinations

public void setDestinations(java.util.List<Place> aDestinations,
                            boolean startAtGPS)
Set the destinations (not null but empty is allowed). This starts the asyncronous route-calculation resulting in our IRouteChangedListener}s to be informed when done.

Parameters:
aDestinations - the destinations to set
startAtGPS - start at the gps-position (navigation) or at the first destination (route-planing)
